metadata.title: USN-5367-1 -- fish vulnerability
metadata.description: Justin Steven discovered that fish was not properly filtering local git configuration directives when running background git commands. A remote unauthenticated attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5367-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  fish - 3.1.0-1.2ubuntu0.1~esm1 fish-common - 3.1.0-1.2ubuntu0.1~esm1 Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
